text: Curtis Cokes (June 15, 1937 â€“ May 29, 2020) was an American boxer. He was born in Dallas, Texas. Cokes was the World Welterweight Champion. In 2003, Cokes was added into the International Boxing Hall of Fame. Cokes died on May 29, 2020 of heart failure in Dallas, aged 82. ==References== Category:1937 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American boxers Category:Deaths from heart failure Category:Sportspeople from Dallas
title: Curtis Cokes
